Posts.Content: Shar34 wrote: Hi all, new here! A quick overview, I found a hard lump last summer, and the initial ultrasound said fibroadenoma, second lump appeared a few months later and had second ultrasound which ended up me being sent for a core biopsy.   I just met with the Dr who said the biopsy came back not malignant but there was thick tissue.  He says there is no "capsule" around the masses which would suggest a fibroadenoma.  He said next week he is going to take my case to the team, and they will discuss it.  What do you think this means?  He says he's 99% sure it's benign (I needed a number to compare)  He did say I could have the lumps taken out, but it's not as simple as a fibroadenoma as my lumps are thick without the capsule around it.   I left a message with the nurse to call me back so I can go over again about my appt.  I did have my husband with me but I was so nervous and hubby did tell me what the dr said, but I'm one that has to make sure I heard everything correctly!! What are your views? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just left Dr's Shar34 Shar34

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2014 05:41PM Shar34 wrote: Thanks for the responses...I thought about writing things down, recording is a great suggestion!  I guess I'm just mostly concerned that I didn't hear that everything is 100% ok, but 99% benign which is almost excellent!  I don't understand why it's not the fibroadenoma which was first thought and why they have to discuss it.  What else could it be?  I'm trying not to be so concerned since there isn't anything too concerning.  The drs nurse was gone and will call me on Monday.
Posts.Title: Just left Dr's Shar34 Shar34

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2014 07:35AM Shar34 wrote: After your biopsy, how long did your lumps feel tender for?  I had mine on the 8th, and they felt bigger when I was back for the follow up appointment on the 17th...the dr didn't seem too concerned, but today they feel a little tender and the actual lumps still feel larger than before the biospy.  I will ask tomorrow when I talk to the nurse, but also wanted to hear anyone else's experience.  Happy Easter!
